title: Rhythm & Timing
description: Explore how aligned you feel about the rhythm of physical connection

questions.text: I feel we're generally in sync about when closeness feels right.

therapeutic.rationale: Timing alignment reduces the friction of mismatched desire. When you're in sync about when closeness feels right, there's less rejection and pursuit.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different perceptions of timing sync indicate a pattern worth exploring. Who tends to want closeness when? How are mismatches handled?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense of timing alignment creates natural opportunities for connection.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How in sync are you about when physical closeness feels right?

questions.text: I can tell when my partner is open to closeness.

therapeutic.rationale: Reading your partner's openness helps you approach at good moments. Missing these signals leads to poorly-timed attempts that can feel like rejection.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner can't read openness signals, the other can make them clearer. Some people signal subtly; others need to learn to read those cues.
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual ability to read each other's openness creates smoother initiation.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you know when your partner is open to closeness?

questions.text: I feel respected when either of us isn't in the mood for closeness.

therapeutic.rationale: How mismatched timing is handled matters more than whether it happens. Graceful handling preserves connection; poor handling creates hurt or pressure.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If timing mismatches aren't handled well, explore what would feel better for each person. Both the initiator and the declining partner have needs.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense that timing mismatches are handled with care creates safety around closeness.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you handle it when one of you isn't in the mood? Does that feel okay?

questions.text: I don't feel pressure around the timing of physical closeness.

therapeutic.rationale: Pressure around timing—whether to be ready, to want more, or to perform—undermines genuine desire. Freedom from pressure allows authentic connection.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner feels pressure, explore where it comes from. The other partner? Internal expectations? Understanding the source helps relieve it.
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual freedom from pressure creates space for desire to emerge naturally.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: Do you ever feel pressure about timing or frequency? What would relieve that?

questions.text: Our physical rhythms feel compatible, even if not identical.

therapeutic.rationale: Compatible rhythms don't mean identical ones—they mean workable differences. Partners with different rhythms can still feel aligned if they navigate the difference well.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If rhythms don't feel compatible, explore what would help. Is it about frequency? Timing? How differences are discussed?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense of compatible rhythms creates peace around physical connection.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How compatible do your physical rhythms feel? What would make them feel more so?
